title: Contributing git issue : refusing to allow a PAT to create or update workflow `.github/...` without `workflow` scope
body:
When using command line to contribute,  I get an error as follows:
in short:
$ git push origin adding_package_libqrencode
To https://github.com/cessenat/spack.git
 ! [remote rejected]       adding_package_libqrencode -> adding_package_libqrencode (refusing to allow a Personal Access Token to create or update workflow `.github/workflows/linux_unit_tests.yaml` without `workflow` scope)
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://github.com/cessenat/spack.git'
So I'm stuck ; should I delete my fork and recreate it ?
Thanks for your gentle help.
Olivier Cessenat

my full command line sequence is (tried both on Linux and Mac) :
git clone https://github.com/cessenat/spack.git
cd spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages
git remote add upstream https://github.com/spack/spack.git
git pull upstream develop
... create libqrencode...
git checkout -b adding_package_libqrencode
cvs add libqrencode
git commit --message "New Package: libqrencode"
git push origin adding_package_libqrencode --set-upstream

and the error message in long:
$ git push origin adding_package_libqrencode
